results.title: Zoo tails
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Gill Lomas and Tosca Looby
results.brief_description: 20 short zoo stories are contained on this tape narrated by an 11 year old boy. Discover tapirs, owl chicks, big cats, hippos, seals, a baby puma, plus many more animals. Filmed at the Melbourne Zoo by ABC’s award winning Natural History Unit.

results.title: Zoo Robbery (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Six kids find themselves in a real life game of cops and robbers when the London Zoo’s star attraction, Yen-Yen the Yeti mysteriously disappears. An action drama to satisfy every kid’s dream. Rated: G

results.title: Zoo Olympics
results.creator_credit: Rooster Studio, Y C Alligatorfilm, Francis Nielsen, Eric Van Beuren and Picha
results.brief_description: Drawn by French animator Picha, here are 26 episodes of the hilarious animal Olympics antics. These are parodies of Olympic events, based vaguely on behaviours in the animal kingdom, such as egg laying and rolling (chickens), slop slurping (pigs) and kangaroo boxing.

results.title: Zoo Family. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions, Howard Neil and Chris Sheil
results.brief_description: Zoo Family was filmed on location at the Melbourne Zoological Gardens and each adventure revolves around the zoo vet and his children, Susie and Nick who manage to get into all sorts of adventures. However it is the animals who are the real stars of the film.

results.title: Zoo Family. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions, Howard Neil and Chris Sheil
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at the Melbourne Zoological Gardens and each adventure revolves around the Mitchell family who live in the zoo. Dr Mitchell is the zoo vet and his children Nick and Susie help out. The real stars however are the animals who feature throughout.

results.title: Zoo Dance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Tony Paice
results.brief_description: Dance movement programme operates at the Royal Melbourne Zoo. Its aims include encouraging creativity and communication between students and teachers, self-expression, building self confidence. Available to children with disabilities as well as the regular school student.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Tony Paice

results.title: Zoo creatures great and small
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development, Rob McCubbin and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Andrew Tribe, zoo veterinarian, and Jeanne de Lacy, zoo keeper, both from Royal Melbourne Zoological Gardens, Zoo Education Service Staff, are interviewed by Trevor Lunn. Animals come to the zoo, often after car accidents and are examined and treated in the veterinary department or nursery. Training for zoo keepers and zoo veterinarians is discussed.

results.title: Zoo baby animals
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description: Opportunity for children to look behind the scenes at the zoo - to see activities in the kitchen and hospital; how baby animals are fed and cared for by their keepers. Shows many animals in attractive outdoor settings and in “children’s zoo” sections in the famous Lincoln Park and Brookfield Zoos of Chicago. Baby animals featured in the film are the lion, tiger, gorilla, bear, elephant, harbor seal, kudu, llama, Barbary sheep, tapir and baboon.
